xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 18 February 2014
xwikidoc.content: <Shubhamtomar> has quit 07:57 <Shubhamtomar> has quit 08:04 <Shubhamtomar> has quit 08:20 <allasm> has quit 08:21 <sdumitriu> has quit 10:06 <sdumitriu> has joined #phenotips 10:19 <sdumitriu1> has joined #phenotips 10:24 <sdumitriu1> has quit 10:45 <sdumitriu1> has joined #phenotips 11:33 <sdumitriu> has quit 12:07 <sdumitriu1> has quit 12:10 <allasm> has joined #phenotips 12:13 <sdumitriu> has joined #phenotips 12:17 <Shubhamtomar> has quit 13:03 <akats> has joined #phenotips 14:41 <akats> How would I convert the csv file into the .ftd, .fdx, and etc. files in the data folder for Solr? 14:43 <sdumitriu> You need to add them through Solr, in a running instance 14:43 <sdumitriu> That's a bit more complex 14:43 <akats> aha. I'm assuming that's complex because the solr home page is broken? 14:44 <sdumitriu> Get a standalone solr distribution package, the same version that we're using (4.0.0) 14:44 <sdumitriu> And they have a script somewhere in the examples for uploading a CSV file to it 14:45 <sdumitriu> example/exampledocs/post.sh 14:46 <sdumitriu> Find it, edit it to use your csv and point to localhost:8080/solr/ethnicity (or whatever core name you chose), run it 14:47 <sdumitriu> You need to define the core first (schema.xml is the most important file), add it to phenotips-standalone 15:44 <akats> Sergiu, is it ok if there is a _version_ field? Ex. 15:44 <sdumitriu> Hm... 15:44 <sdumitriu> Why? 15:45 <akats> Wouldn't let me run with the ball otherwise. Solr was very insistent on it. 16:32 <akats> has quit 16:33 <allasm> has quit 16:33 <sdumitriu> has quit 16:33 <allasm> has joined #phenotips 16:34 <sdumitriu> has joined #phenotips 16:35 <akats> has joined #phenotips 16:52 <sdumitriu> has quit 16:52 <allasm> has quit 16:54 <akats> has joined #phenotips 16:55 <sdumitriu> has joined #phenotips 17:18 <phenotips_org> has joined #phenotips 17:20 <akats> by the way where should I upload the scraped text and xml files? 17:21 <sdumitriu> How big are those? 17:23 <akats> tiny 17:23 <akats> 16 and 130 kb 17:36 <sdumitriu> Upload them on dev.phenotips.org somewhere 17:41 <akats> ok 17:41 <akats> I'm also having trouble finding the code that needs to be changed in order for the suggest to take the new Solr index 17:52 <akats> nevermind i think i found it 18:00 <akats> has quit 18:06 <allasm> has joined #phenotips 18:59 <phenotips_org> has joined #phenotips
